description: Breakthrough Energy is dedicated to helping humanity avoid a climate disaster. Through investment vehicles, philanthropic programs, policy advocacy, and other activities, we’re committed to scaling the technologies we need to reach net-zero emissions by 2050.
name: Breakthrough Energy
tagline: Advancing clean, reliable, affordable energy solutions that will lead us to a net-zero emissions future.

updates.text:
🎉 Exciting News! NitroVolt has raised €3.5M to innovate on decentralized and green ammonia technology! 🎉 

We’re thrilled to announce the close of our €3.5M seed round, co-led by BackingMinds and the Export and Investment Fund of Denmark, alongside a remarkable consortium of amazing investors each bringing something unique to the team: Breakthrough Energy Fellowship, EQT Foundation, Satgana, and Division Q. Thank you all for your confidence in NitroVolt's mission to make ammonia production sustainable! 🙌✨
 
A special shoutout to those who have been supporting us with this investment round: LASSEN RICARD, Highbridge Law Firm for legal support and V2 Communications for PR support – your help has been invaluable. 💪🌟
 
This investment will accelerate NitroVolt’s efforts to scale up sustainable and decentralized ammonia production by allowing us to expand the fantastic NitroTeam and build our first on-site Demo Unit. ⚡ 🌱 If you're interested in joining the team, keep an eye out for job postings! 
 
Thank you to everyone involved for helping NitroVolt take this pivotal step toward a greener future. Together, we’re pushing the boundaries and working on making green ammonia affordable and available to all! 💚🌍
 
#greenammonia #sustainableenergy #cleantech #NitroVolt #seedround

🌟 Speaker Spotlight: Penelope Le Menestrel, Manager Europe at Breakthrough Energy 

Pénélope joined Breakthrough Energy in January 2022, bringing a rich background in energy transition, strategy, market intelligence, and project management. With experience as a strategy consultant in the U.S. and work in hydrogen energy strategy at Air Liquide in France, Pénélope has a deep commitment to advancing sustainable energy solutions. 🌍

Catch her insights at the opening session: 
📅 Tuesday, 26 Nov
🕙 10:00 AM – 12:00 PM CET - Powering Growth: How to Finance the Battery Value Chain?

This session is ideal for those interested in financing mechanisms and strategies to support the growth of Europe’s battery ecosystem. ⚡

#BID2024

In 2024, Bill Gates and Breakthrough Energy noticed a subtle yet powerful shift in how the private sector began deploying clean tech. 

I had a chance to discuss this with Bill recently. And as our conversation goes live this morning on the #OptimisticOutlook podcast, I wanted to devote a newsletter to a critical topic: the people now guiding this latest industrial revolution. After all, technology is only as powerful as the people behind it.

Day 2 at #COP29 in Baku with Alberto Toril Castro, Anca Gurzu, and Matteo Mirolo.

Highlights for me so far:

🌍 A panel discussion with Lilyana Pavlova, Ambroise Fayolle (EIB), Iliyana Tsanova (EC), Jurgen Rigterink (EBRD), and Delyana Ivanova (Bulgarian Development Bank) on 'Powering up Competitiveness in the CEE region' organized by the Green Transition Forum. We discussed lessons from the #Dragi report, and what it takes to help European companies #scale. 

🔴 This is a problem in the #CEE region in particular. While potential is big (in 2023, over 80 startups across 10 CEE countries secured fresh funding to scale their energy-focused solutions in the region and beyond), there are problems with access to smart capital and later-stage funding. As a result, 40% of founders who studied at #universities in CEE do not stay in the same country to found their #startup. 

🌍 A roundtable on #energycorridors organized by S&P Global Commodity Insights, where speakers from around the globe discussed the benefits of green energy corridors, how to realize them, and how to combine them with transport and digital corridors. I yet remain to be convinced that much of this can be realized, especially in #Europe, considering #supplychain bottlenecks we already see in existing large-scale infrastructure projects.

🌍 A Climate #Security Reflection Dinner, hosted by Benedikt Franke of the Munich Security Conference, with an inspiring intervention by Tony Agotha, #EU Special Envoy for Climate and Environment Diplomacy on the EU's role in the world and its efforts to lead on #climateaction. 

My take is that climate Security and #energyresilience need to go hand in hand. While we strive for #netzero, we need to avoid dependencies on any one #fuel, #technology, or country, and also protect our #infrastructure. That's why we created the Energy Resilience Leadership Group at the #MSC two years ago. It's a coalition of corporates and emerging cleantech players to accelerate the deployment of emerging tech.

🌍 Columbia University Roundtable on 'Reconciling Climate and #Trade: Principles and Practicalities', with interesting reflections on whether or not a climate and trade agreement is feasible under #WTO rules. Someone said that a future alternative #multilateral approach might not be centered in #DC or #Brussels - if anyone needed a reminder of how the world is changing. I was also happy to meet colleagues from the BMW Foundation Herbert Quandt, Grégoire Roos, Dr. Bryan Scheler, and Paula Schmid Schmidsfelden.

🌍 A great discussion with team of Clean Air Task Force, together with my colleague Alberto Toril Castro. The team around Larissa Lee Beck, Kasparas Spokas and others is extremely insightful and impactful across Europe, the #US, and #MiddleEast, I came out of that discussion with plenty of new ideas.

More to come.

Excited to join the Congressional Hispanic Caucus Institute (CHCI)'s Symposium on Energy, Infrastructure, and Sustainability to talk about the ways clean energy technologies benefit the lives of Latinos and what's on the agenda for energy next year. Join me on November 20!! #CHCI

🚨 REMINDER: Applications are Open until December 2! 🚨
 
We’re thrilled to announce that applications for the next cohort of Breakthrough Energy #Fellows are open!
 
Are you or someone in your network working on early-stage climatetech innovation? Our program is designed to accelerate groundbreaking ideas, offering world-class support to innovators tackling the toughest barriers in climate technology.
 
Who should apply?
We’re looking for early-stage (~TRL 1-4) climatetech companies with:
🔹 Potential to reduce GHG emissions by 500M tons/year at scale
🔹 Less than ~$2M in dilutive funding raised
🔹 High impact potential with a need for technical derisking
 
What we offer:
🌱 Significant R&D funding
🌱 A 1-year program accelerating key milestones
🌱 Technical and commercialization support
🌱 Access to Breakthrough Energy’s global network
 
📅 Deadline: Submit your application or nominate a founder by Monday, December 2!

👉 Learn more about our cutting-edge work and apply at the link below. Don’t miss this chance to be part of the next generation of climate innovators!

befellows.smapply.org
